kBET function

Source: R/DO.EvalIntegration.R
run_kbet.Rd

kBET quantifies batch mixing in single-cell data by testing whether local neighborhood batch composition deviates from the global distribution, with lower rejection indicating better integration.

Usage

run_kbet(
  sce_object,
  embedding,
  batch,
  cells.use = NULL,
  subsample = NULL,
  min_per_batch = NULL,
  ...
)

Arguments

sce_object

Seurat or SCE object.

embedding

Name of the embedding to test

batch

Name of the sample column in meta.data

cells.use

specify a specific set of cells as vector

subsample

set a fraction for stratified subsetting

min_per_batch

should always be higher than or equal k0

Value

list with summary stats of kBET

Author

Mariano Ruz Jurado

On this page
